term.title: one-photon photochromism

item.text: Photochromic process involving a one-photon mechanism. In this case, the photoproduct B is formed from the singlet or from the triplet state of the thermodynamically-stable molecular entity A.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 377 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
